content:
From: "W. Douglas Maurer" <maurer@gwu.edu>
I have Isabelle 2013 installed on all three major platforms, Windows,
Mac, and Unix. For some reason I never got the notice that there was
a new version, Isabelle 2014. However, I now have installation
instructions for Isabelle 2014 on all three major platforms. Here is
my question: On the major platforms, how do I uninstall Isabelle
2013? I say this because I don't want to install Isabelle 2014, only
to find out that at least one of the platforms is confused because it
has two copies of some piece of Isabelle, one for 2013 and one for
2014, and it chooses the wrong one, and I end up with a hybrid
mishmash of 2013 and 2014 that doesn't work at all. Or am I worrying
about nothing? -WDMaurer

From: Lawrence Paulson <lp15@cam.ac.uk>
Multiple versions should coexist without problems. But to uninstall, just delete the entire Isabelle2013 directory, wherever you put it. The Mac version is an app, which just delete.

Larry Paulson
